Title: Place to Sleep
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Night falls. Humidity rises from the ground. And the air feels cold. The entire forest seems to be deprived of light. Strange shadows bend their bodies into different shapes, silently dissolving into the darkness. Howls of wolves and bears seem to be coming from a distance. There is still a long way to go. And it seems you have to find a place for the night before you can move on after the sun rises and lights the way.

OptionDesc[1]: On the huge tree with a spider web
OptionDesc[2]: On the short tree that is easier to climb
Title: Place to Sleep
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: You think for a moment and decide to stay here for the night.

Title: Place to Sleep
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: You fall into a deep sleep. The three spiders on the web are weaving your dream. You dream of fire, crying, endless fields of flowers, a hovering dragon, a girl standing on a balcony up high... And now you wake up in the morning sunlight. The road ahead feels just as unpredictable as the dream you had.

Title: Place to Sleep
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: You grab the lowest branch of the tree, but the tree suddenly starts to shake violently right when you begin to climb...

Title: Campfire
EventDesc: A white-gray smoke rises above the forest. You decide to go in the direction of the smoke.

OptionDesc[3]: Move on
Title: Campfire
EventDesc: There are only campfire remnants and ashes. There are no people or other living beings around. Looking at the remnants and ashes, you...

Title: Campfire
EventDesc: You pick up a branch and start to go through the remnants and ashes. There are some burnt bones that you can't tell their original shape. You move away a broken bone and find a bright gem in the ashes.

Title: Campfire
EventDesc: You sit down by the extinguished campfire, hoping someone will come back here. Time passes through the branches of the trees and casts a spell that gently closes your eyes. And the moment you open your eyes, sparks are flying out from the campfire...

Title: Campfire
EventDesc: You move forward carefully in the opposite direction from where you came from and away from the campfire, but there is still no traces of other people. Fortunately, you come across a bush full of winter strawberries.

OptionDesc[1]: Follow the guidance of the feather
OptionDesc[2]: Follow the direction of the sunrise
Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: You wander around in the forest. You listen to the sound of the wind. You travel after sunrise and rest after sunset. You gargle with the sweet stream water and eat the fruits on the trees. Gradually, you master the survival skills in the forest but also lose your way.

Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: You pick up a feather dropped from some kind of gray bird and figure out the direction to go through divination. Following the guidance of the feather, you arrive at the source of the water. You move forward along the stream.

Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: Based on some shallow knowledge that appears in your mind, you decide to determine a direction to go. You walk slowly in the direction of the sunrise.

OptionDesc[2]: I can be a helper on board
OptionDesc[3]: Be honest and ask for help
Title: Board
RoleContent: This is not a toy ship bound for Debussy's Joyous Island.
EventDesc: After a brief talk, you tell the sailor that you want to join their voyage to the distant kingdom. The sailor's description of the city capital is exactly what you remember about Naples. However, you search all your pockets and can't find any money.

Title: Board
RoleContent: You...
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Where did you get this?
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Do you know a traveler with purple eyes?
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Nothing... Forget it.
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
EventDesc: The sailor gives you a glance with a faint smile without saying anything. He allows you to get on board but doesn't respond to your proposal.

Title: Board
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Have you seen a dragon before?
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: We haven't seen a dragon for a very long time.
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: 'The dragon comes with the pipe music.'
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: But at the very beginning, the dragon came without warning.
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: The only thing we knew was it always targeted at a crowd.
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: It would bring the crowd from the ground and let them fall from above. It attacked villages and people, destroying everything in its sight.
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

OptionDesc[3]: I want to have a walk around
Title: On the Ship
EventDesc: You get on the ship. The sailor who guides you asks you where you want to go.

Title: On the Ship
EventDesc: I want to have a walk around

OptionDesc[2]: Return to the cabin to rest
Title: Sailor
EventDesc: The sun goes down under the horizon. It starts to get dark on the ship. The sailor on duty tonight is a tall man with sallow skin, who walks with a slight limp. You notice that he is one of the sailors whom you met when boarding. He is always quiet during the day and tends to open up during the night.

Title: Sailor
EventDesc: He stands on the deck far from the cabin while staring at it. He waves at you and only begins to talk when you get close.

Title: Sailor
RoleContent: I guess I'm old. Start to talk on and on about unrelated stuff. You don't wanna listen to this, do you?
EventDesc: The sailor smiles, which softens his face.

Title: Sailor
RoleContent: It's late. Let's call it a night.
EventDesc: The sailor smiles, which softens his face.

Title: Sailor
EventDesc: You say goodbye to the sailor. The gentle wind from the sea makes you sleepy. You go back to the cabin and have a long dream.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: You open your eyes and see a clear sky. There is a smell of the sea in the air. You have a fuzzy memory of being thrown up by the waves while screaming for help. The last thing you saw was the dragon holding its head high and two huge claws coming at you. You dodged and held tight to the small boat under your chest to keep yourself from drowning.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: Under your body is soft sand. You sit up slowly. What meets your eyes is the calm sea. The waves are lapping at your feet.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: You take a walk around. Although there are still a lot of things to find out, you're pretty sure that you're on an island. Is this an uninhabited island?

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: The sunshine is perfect. Your clothes were dried before you're fully awake.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: You see something moving and go after the figure. Is it Caliban or Friday? You decide to find out.

Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: You notice that there are some small buds surrounded by long sword-shaped leaves in the grass on the ground. Fragile and beautiful, they stretch forward as if they are guiding you somewhere. You move forward in the direction they point.

Title: Village
EventDesc: The appearance of the dragon has caused a disturbance in the village. The villagers pick up their tools and weapons and rush to the venue only to find you slowly climbing down from the roof.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Outsiders are not welcome here.
EventDesc: You explain everything, but the villagers don't seem convinced. They still stand in your way like an iron wall.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Are you with the piper?
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
RoleContent: You said you followed the dragon here?
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Disaster! Disaster! The disaster has come to our village!
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Get out! Get out!
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
EventDesc: I will only stay for a short time and will leave soon

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: May! May!
EventDesc: You wander around the village entrance, having no clue what to do or where to go next. The cries of a desperate woman attract your attention.

OptionDesc[2]: Approach and ask if she is all right.
Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: Where are you, May?
EventDesc: You wander around the village entrance, having no clue what to do or where to go next. The cries of a desperate woman attract your attention.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: (Sobs)
EventDesc: The woman was one of those who wanted to drive you out of the village. You leave as you don't want to get into trouble.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: May is gone... My May is gone.
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: I searched the whole village but still couldn't find him!
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: No one dares to go outside the village. They say there's a dragon and a monster out there...
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: Could it be that May was enchanted by the strange pipe music and headed for the dragon's lair?
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

OptionDesc[1]: Tell her you will help her find May
OptionDesc[2]: Tell her you have to leave for something more important
Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: It's all my fault!
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

OptionDesc[1]: Sneak into the village to look for clues
OptionDesc[2]: Look for the "Dragon's Lair" mentioned by the woman later
Title: Village Entrance
EventDesc: Where to start?

Title: Village Entrance
EventDesc: Sneak into the village to look for clues

Title: Village Entrance
EventDesc: Tell her you have to leave for something more important

Title: The Lost One
EventDesc: You walk on the wasteland. It is where the dragon's lair locates according to the legend. Many who came are forever buried here. This deserted graveyard extends forward into the darkness on the horizon. Under your feet are stones of different sizes. A noise comes from ahead...

OptionDesc[3]: Leave
Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I'm not afraid of you!
EventDesc: You see a little boy confronting a monster. He picks up a stone and is about to throw it at the monster.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Are you... Are you a champion?
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Are you here to kill the dragon as well?
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Me?
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I'm a champion too!
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I'm not afraid of you!
EventDesc: Save him

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: That was awesome!
EventDesc: After winning the battle

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Are you a true champion?

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Mom said the piper was bad.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I want to prove her wrong.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: How could a bad person play such a beautiful tune?

Title: The Lost One
EventDesc: Walk by

Title: The Lost One
EventDesc: Leave

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: There is a dark forest ahead. The color of the branches doesn't seem to change no matter how the sunlight changes. You take a closer look at it. The trees are also grotesque in shape.

OptionDesc[3]: Leave
Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Through the shadow of the leaves, you see a witch in the form of a beautiful girl singing a strange song among the tall flowering bush supported by magic. However, you can't hear anything as the voice is swallowed up by the shadow of the leaves.

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Leave

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: The witch reveals her old face and shouts at you, trying to scare you off. But you don't look away. Seeing this, the witch stops what she's doing. She gives you a glance and then disappears with the flowers.

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: The witch reveals her old face, which doesn't seem to scare you. Your reaction has won the witch's respect. She restores her youthful appearance, gives you a glance, and then disappears with the flowers, leaving a silver bell behind.

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Leave

Title: Campfire
EventDesc: A white-gray smoke rises above the forest. You decide to go in the direction of the smoke.

Title: Story Time
RoleContent: Where was I?
EventDesc: The sea is calm. You dream about the storytelling sailor almost every night, who tells stories about the past that is different from today, about the song of returning home, and about the disaster brought by the dragon.

Title: Story Time
EventDesc: I guess I'm old. Start to talk on and on about the past.

EventDesc: You say goodbye to the sailor. The gentle wind from the sea makes you sleepy. You go back to the cabin and have a long dream.

OptionDesc[1]: Tell me more about the traveler
OptionDesc[2]: I want to have some rest back at my cabin

RoleContent: Shall we call it a night?

EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
EventDesc: I will only stay for a short time and will leave soon

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: May! May!
EventDesc: You wander around the village entrance, having no clue what to do or where to go next. The cries of a desperate woman attract your attention.

OptionDesc[2]: Approach and ask if she is all right.
Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: Where are you, May?
EventDesc: You wander around the village entrance, having no clue what to do or where to go next. The cries of a desperate woman attract your attention.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: (Sobs)
EventDesc: The woman was one of those who wanted to drive you out of the village. You leave as you don't want to get into trouble.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: May is gone... My May is gone.
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: I searched the whole village but still couldn't find him!
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: No one dares to go outside the village. They say there's a dragon and a monster out there...
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: Could it be that May was enchanted by the strange pipe music and headed for the dragon's lair?
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

OptionDesc[1]: Tell her you will help her find May
OptionDesc[2]: Tell her you have to leave for something more important
Title: Village Entrance
RoleContent: It's all my fault!
EventDesc: You go up to her and ask her if she needs any help.

OptionDesc[1]: Sneak into the village to look for clues
OptionDesc[2]: Look for the "Dragon's Lair" mentioned by the woman later
Title: Village Entrance
EventDesc: Where to start?

Title: Village Entrance
EventDesc: Sneak into the village to look for clues

Title: Village Entrance
EventDesc: Tell her you have to leave for something more important

Title: The Lost One
EventDesc: You walk on the wasteland. It is where the dragon's lair locates according to the legend. Many who came are forever buried here. This deserted graveyard extends forward into the darkness on the horizon. Under your feet are stones of different sizes. A noise comes from ahead...

OptionDesc[3]: Leave
Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I'm not afraid of you!
EventDesc: You see a little boy confronting a monster. He picks up a stone and is about to throw it at the monster.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Are you... Are you a champion?
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Are you here to kill the dragon as well?
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Me?
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I'm a champion too!
EventDesc: You stop the boy and lead him to safety.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I'm not afraid of you!
EventDesc: Save him

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: That was awesome!
EventDesc: After winning the battle

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Are you a true champion?

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: Mom said the piper was bad.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: I want to prove her wrong.

Title: The Lost One
RoleContent: How could a bad person play such a beautiful tune?

Title: The Lost One
EventDesc: Walk by

Title: The Lost One
EventDesc: Leave

OptionDesc[1]: Tell the woman where you saw the boy
OptionDesc[2]: Take the boy you saved to the woman
Title: Woman
EventDesc: You walk to the village. The woman is still wandering around the village entrance anxiously. You speed up your pace...

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Thank you! You're a good person!
EventDesc: The woman bows to you and immediately runs back to the village. You follow her.

Title: Woman
RoleContent: We have to find May... Honey... Honey... I have news about May!

Title: Woman
RoleContent: (Sobs)
EventDesc: The woman raises her hand, but instead of swinging her slap, she bursts into tears. She bends over and hugs the boy tightly while repeating his name over and over again as if she could draw strength from this.

Title: Woman
RoleContent: May... May... My May...

Title: Woman
RoleContent: As long as you're fine...

Title: Woman
RoleContent: I'm fine!

Title: Woman
RoleContent: The true champion saved me!

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Are you a champion?
EventDesc: The woman gets up after she finally calms down. She holds the shoulders of the child, and together they bow to you.

Title: Woman
EventDesc: I'm not a champion

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Please don't go any further!
EventDesc: You start talking to the woman.

Title: Woman
RoleContent: The kingdom capital sent an army to the dragon's lair days ago and no one has returned.

OptionDesc[2]: I'll gather more info before taking any action.
Title: Woman
RoleContent: I heard the princess of the kingdom was missing a long time ago. I think either she was caught by the dragon or she was killed by the evil piper!

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Slaying a dragon is no joke.
EventDesc: The woman falls silent for a moment. Instead of stopping you, she hopes you can go back to the village with her first.

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Are you going to go unarmed?

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Follow me.

Title: Woman
RoleContent: That's great, young one!
EventDesc: You follow the woman into the village.

Title: Woman
RoleContent: Don't be silly and look for the dragon!

OptionDesc[2]: Tell him that it was not a big deal
Title: Blacksmith
RoleContent: Are you the outsider who saved May?
EventDesc: This time no villagers are yelling at you. Following the woman, you arrive at a shabby blacksmith shop. Inside it, various farm tools are scattered around on the ground.

Title: Blacksmith
RoleContent: They say you're a champion.
EventDesc: There seems to be a smile across the blacksmith's face. He pulls out an old iron sword out of nowhere and hands it to you.

Title: Blacksmith
RoleContent: A champion has to have a sword.
EventDesc: There seems to be a smile across the blacksmith's face. He pulls out an old iron sword out of nowhere and hands it to you.

Title: Blacksmith
EventDesc: The blacksmith nods and gets back to his work at hand.

Title: City Gate
EventDesc: Severely injured, the dragon flies away. You follow the dragon to the city gate. It has already been broken. People are running around for life. The soldiers of the army are defending the gate and the people behind it against the monster with their bodies.

Title: City Gate
EventDesc: Item Obtained

Title: City Gate
EventDesc: Pursue the dragon

Title: Balcony
EventDesc: The city capital is filled with fire and smoke. The dragon spread its invisible wings of death and flies toward the castle. People are running around crying and screaming. Nothing has changed. All you can hear are screams. You run in the opposite direction from the crowd...

Title: Balcony
EventDesc: You look up and see the balcony where the girl stands in your dream. The dragon is hovering above the balcony. You break into the palace. It is occupied by the monster. Someone is screaming!

Title: Balcony
EventDesc: Go help

Title: Balcony
EventDesc: Go directly to the balcony

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: There is a dark forest ahead. The color of the branches doesn't seem to change no matter how the sunlight changes. You take a closer look at it. The trees are also grotesque in shape.

OptionDesc[3]: Leave
Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Through the shadow of the leaves, you see a witch in the form of a beautiful girl singing a strange song among the tall flowering bush supported by magic. However, you can't hear anything as the voice is swallowed up by the shadow of the leaves.

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Leave

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: The witch reveals her old face and shouts at you, trying to scare you off. But you don't look away. Seeing this, the witch stops what she's doing. She gives you a glance and then disappears with the flowers.

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: The witch reveals her old face, which doesn't seem to scare you. Your reaction has won the witch's respect. She restores her youthful appearance, gives you a glance, and then disappears with the flowers, leaving a silver bell behind.

Title: Deep in the Forest
TitleContent: Something Mysterious Is About to Happen
EventDesc: Leave

OptionDesc[1]: The magic that makes the flowers bloom
OptionDesc[2]: The way to slay the dragon
OptionDesc[3]: The magic that kills any living being
Title: Magic
EventDesc: You stay where the witch appeared and ask her sincerely for help. You want her to teach you...

Title: Magic
RoleContent: You already have a sword.
EventDesc: The witch slowly emerges from the other end of the forest like the morning mist as if she has heard your request. She stares at you, and it feels like she can see your soul through your body.

Title: Magic
RoleContent: It has already taken the shape of the champion's sword.

Title: Magic
RoleContent: I will enchant it, granting it the power to break the spiral, slay the dragon, and save the world.

Title: Magic
RoleContent: I will refine it with the blessing of the iris, the crystal of the ashes of the girl trapped in endless reincarnation, along with her singing and memories.

Title: Magic
RoleContent: I still lack the "singing." Go bring it to me.

Title: Magic
RoleContent: And I will make you a real champion's sword.

Title: Magic
EventDesc: Your voice is drowned by the sound of the wind. Night falls, but the witch still doesn't respond.

OptionDesc[1]: Follow the guidance of the buds
OptionDesc[2]: Follow the direction of the sunrise
OptionDesc[3]: Follow the guidance of the feather
Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: You wander around in the forest. You listen to the sound of the wind. You travel after sunrise and rest after sunset. You gargle with the sweet stream water and eat the fruits on the trees. Gradually, you master the survival skills in the forest but also lose your way.

Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: You pick up a feather dropped from some kind of gray bird and figure out the direction to go through divination. Following the guidance of the feather, you arrive at the source of the water. You move forward along the stream.

Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: Based on some shallow knowledge that appears in your mind, you decide to determine a direction to go. You walk slowly in the direction of the sunrise.

Title: Flower and Feather
EventDesc: You notice that there are some small buds surrounded by long sword-shaped leaves in the grass on the ground. Fragile and beautiful, they stretch forward as if they are guiding you somewhere. You move forward in the direction they point.

OptionDesc[2]: I can be a helper on board
OptionDesc[3]: Be honest and ask for help
Title: Board
RoleContent: This is not a toy ship bound for Debussy's Joyous Island.
EventDesc: After a brief talk, you tell the sailor that you want to join their voyage to the distant kingdom. The sailor's description of the city capital is exactly what you remember about Naples. However, you search all your pockets and can't find any money.

Title: Board
RoleContent: You...
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Where did you get this?
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Do you know a traveler with purple eyes?
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Nothing... Forget it.
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you. He says something, but it doesn't answer your question. He agrees to let you get on the ship but refuses to take the gem.

Title: Board
EventDesc: The sailor gives you a glance with a faint smile without saying anything. He allows you to get on board but doesn't respond to your proposal.

Title: Board
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board without saying anything.

Title: Board
RoleContent: Have you seen a dragon before?
EventDesc: The sailor looks at you as if he recalls a distant memory. He allows you to board in the end.

Title: Board
RoleContent: We haven't seen a dragon for a very long time.

Title: Board
RoleContent: 'The dragon comes with the pipe music.'

Title: Board
RoleContent: But at the very beginning, the dragon came without warning.

Title: Board
RoleContent: The only thing we knew was it always targeted at a crowd.

Title: Board
RoleContent: It would bring the crowd from the ground and let them fall from above. It attacked villages and people, destroying everything in its sight.

OptionDesc[3]: I'm not interested
Title: Story Time
RoleContent: Where was I?
EventDesc: The sea is calm. You dream about the storytelling sailor almost every night, who tells stories about the past that is different from today, about the song of returning home, and about the disaster brought by the dragon.

Title: Story Time
EventDesc: I guess I'm old. Start to talk on and on about the past.

Title: Story Time
EventDesc: You say goodbye to the sailor. The gentle wind from the sea makes you sleepy. You go back to the cabin and have a long dream.

OptionDesc[1]: Tell me more about the traveler
OptionDesc[2]: I want to have some rest back at my cabin
Title: Story Time
RoleContent: Shall we call it a night?

Title: Story Time
EventDesc: You say goodbye to the sailor. The gentle wind from the sea makes you sleepy. You go back to the cabin and have a long dream.

OptionDesc[1]: Ask the sailor if he still remember the tune of "The Song of Siren"
OptionDesc[2]: Ask the sailor to teach you sing the original "The Song of Siren"
Title: Story Time
TitleContent: A New Option Emerges

Title: Story Time
RoleContent: So you are interested about the song we sing on the sea?
EventDesc: Ask the sailor if he still remember the tune of "The Song of Siren"

Title: Story Time
RoleContent: The song about returning home you heard the sailors singing the other night is a variation of The Song of Siren.

Title: Story Time
RoleContent: The song has been passed on, connecting us together.

Title: Story Time
RoleContent: Haha, of course.
EventDesc: Ask the sailor to teach you sing the original "The Song of Siren"

Title: Story Time
RoleContent: The song about returning home you heard the sailors singing the other night is a variation of The Song of Siren.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: You open your eyes and see a clear sky. There is a smell of the sea in the air. You have a fuzzy memory of being thrown up by the waves while screaming for help. The last thing you saw was the dragon holding its head high and two huge claws coming at you. You dodged and held tight to the small boat under your chest to keep yourself from drowning.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: Under your body is soft sand. You sit up slowly. What meets your eyes is the calm sea. The waves are lapping at your feet.

OptionDesc[3]: Walk along the coast
Title: Castaway
EventDesc: You take a walk around. Although there are still a lot of things to find out, you're pretty sure that you're on an island. Is this an uninhabited island?

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: The sunshine is perfect. Your clothes were dried before you're fully awake.

Title: Castaway
EventDesc: You see something moving and go after the figure. Is it Caliban or Friday? You decide to find out.

OptionDesc[3]: I will only stay for a short time and will leave soon
Title: Village
EventDesc: The appearance of the dragon has caused a disturbance in the village. The villagers pick up their tools and weapons and rush to the venue only to find you slowly climbing down from the roof.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Outsiders are not welcome here.
EventDesc: You explain everything, but the villagers don't seem convinced. They still stand in your way like an iron wall.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Are you with the piper?
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
RoleContent: You said you followed the dragon here?
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Disaster! Disaster! The disaster has come to our village!
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
RoleContent: Get out! Get out!
EventDesc: You explain everything and the villagers begin to whisper to each other. They look at you in an unfriendly way. Someone throws a stone at you.

Title: Village
EventDesc: I will only stay for a short time and will leave soon

Title: City Gate
EventDesc: Severely injured, the dragon flies away. You follow the dragon to the city gate. It has already been broken. People are running around for life. The soldiers of the army are defending the gate and the people behind it against the monster with their bodies.

Title: Balcony
EventDesc: The city capital is filled with fire and smoke. The dragon spread its invisible wings of death and flies toward the castle. People are running around crying and screaming. Nothing has changed. All you can hear are screams. You run in the opposite direction from the crowd...

OptionDesc[3]: Go directly to the balcony
Title: Balcony
EventDesc: You look up and see the balcony where the girl stands in your dream. The dragon is hovering above the balcony. You break into the palace. It is occupied by the monster. Someone is screaming!
